item.title: Writeup LKSN ITNSA NTB 2021 - Linux Actual
item.description: Table Of Contents Introduction TASK 1 CONFIGURATION ON DEBIAN 10 SERVER (server1) TASK 2 CONFIGURATION ON DEBIAN 10 SERVER (server254) Summary REWRITE Bagian IP Configuration | Menambahkan gateway di sisi server254 Hostname menggunakan /etc/resolve Introduction Hello, I’m back in the final writeup of the third of three questions titled “Linux Actual,” which is part of ITNSA’s NTB LKSN competition in 2021. We are now asked to configure servers and clients using Linux Debian 10.

item.title: Writeup LKSN ITNSA NTB 2021 - Packet Tracer Troubleshoot
item.description: Table Of Contents Introduction Troubleshooting 1 (Point: 25) Questions Answers Troubleshooting 2 (Point: 25) Questions Answers Troubleshooting 3 (Point: 25) Questions Answers Troubleshooting 4 (Point: 25) Questions Answers Summary Introduction Hello, everyone. Today’s post is based on the second of three questions titled “Packet Tracer Troubleshooting” that will be part of the NTB LKSN competition from ITNSA in 2021. Unlike the previous question, this time, we are asked to troubleshoot the configuration of network devices with a predetermined network topology using Cisco Packet Tracer.

item.title: Writeup LKSN ITNSA NTB 2021 - Network Actual & Future Network

Configuration at HQ MATARAM Completed Points: 5% Task 4 SW_HQ_L2 Switch Configuration at HQ MATARAM Completed Points: 3% Task 5 Admin2 PC Configuration and Verification at HQ MATARAM Completed Points: 0% Task 6 Wireless Controller (WLC) Configuration at HQ MATARAM Completed Points: 8% Task 7 LeighWeight Access Point (LWAP) Configuration at HQ MATARAM Completed Points: 0% Task 8 End Device Configuration and Verification on HRD and MARKETING VLANs at HQ MATARAM Completed Points: 0% Task 9 BRANCH SUMBAWA Server Configuration Completed Points: 10% Task 10 BRANCH SUMBAWA Router Configuration Completed Points: 11% Task 11 SW_BRANCH Switch Configuration at BRANCH SUMBAWA Completed Points: 3% Task 12 DHCP Client Configuration and Internet Connection Verification on VLAN 2 SALES PC at BRANCH SUMBAWA Completed Points: 0% Task 13 WRT_BRANCH Wireless Router Configuration at BRANCH SUMBAWA Completed Points: 4% Task 14 End Device Configuration and Verification at WLAN ENGINEER BRANCH SUMBAWA Completed Points: 2% Task 15 VPN Configuration on an HQ MATARAM Router utilizing GRE over IPSec and OSPF Completed Points: 8% Task 16 VPN Configuration on an BRANCH SUMBAWA Router utilizing GRE over IPSec and OSPF Completed Points: 8% Task 17 VPN Connection Verification from the End Device at HQ MATARAM Completed Points: 0% Task 18 VPN Connection Verification from the End Device at BRANCH SUMBAWA Completed Points: 0% Task 19 Roled Based Access Control (RBAC) configuration at router HQ MATARAM Completed Points: 1% Task 20 Roled Based Access Control (RBAC) configuration at router BRANCH SUMBAWA Completed Points: 1% Complete Configuration Router HQ MATARAM Router BRANCH SUMBAWA Summary Introduction This writeup is based on the first of three questions titled “Actual Networks & Future Networks” that were part of the NTB LKSN competition from ITNSA in 2021.

item.title: eNSP VS WSL 2
item.description: Table Of Contents TLDR Issues Setup Troubleshoot Summary TLDR Conflicts between Hypervisor. Issues To learn more about Huawei devices, I decided to use the Huawei Enterprise Network Simulator Platform eNSP to simulate an enterprise network. So I followed the tutorial from an internet blog, but when I tried to run the program, I received the error message “Failed to start device AR1 error code 40.” in eNSP. Failed to start device AR1
